ResourceHeader.ResourceName: IMAGE Radio Plasma Imager (RPI) Plasmagram data in CDF at NASA CDAWeb

RevisionEvent.Note: Only known prior ReleaseDate of the metadata

Added PublicationInfo. Added ResourceType and NamingAuthority. Changed http to https in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Fixed version number separator in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Matched version number in schemaLocation attribute to updated value in Version tag. ZCB

ResourceHeader.Description: Software suggested by the science team for CDF file visualization: (1) Plotting tool at the CDAWeb portal, (2) For analysis beyond static image inspection, including color scale optimization, zooming, text export, alternative data representations in physical units, detailed frequency and time information, overlaid model fpe and fce graphs, and EPS quality figures, use BinBrowser software at UML, http://ulcar.uml.edu/rpi.html
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: Users please acknowledge Coordinated Data Analysis Web (CDAWeb) at the NASA Goddard Space Flight Center and RPI Principal Investigator Prof. B. W. Reinisch of the University of Massachusetts Lowell for making these CDF files available.

InformationURL.Name: IMAGE RPI Instrument Page
InformationURL.Description: IMAGE RPI Instrument page maintained by NASA GSFC with RPI facts, description, team, data, documents, discoveries, and related links sections

InformationURL.Name: IMAGE RPI Instrument Page at UML
InformationURL.Description: IMAGE RPI Instrument page maintained by University of Massachusetts Lowell with RPI description, team, software downloads, software user guides, access to CORPRAL automated prospecting results, mission planning tools and commanding guide, data model descriptions for Level 0 and 1, sonification files of 2003 Halloween storm, and useful links

AccessURL.Name: CDAWeb FTP access to IMAGE RPI wave measurements (plasmagrams)
AccessURL.Description: FTP access to repository of IMAGE RPI Plasmagrams in CDF format at NASA CDAWeb.

AccessURL.Name: CDAWeb access portal to IMAGE RPI Plasmagrams
AccessURL.Description: Repository of IMAGE RPI Plasmagrams in CDF format at NASA CDAWeb, accessible via web interface. Name of the data resource: IM_K0_RPI.

AccessInformation.Acknowledgement: Users please acknowledge Coordinated Data Analysis Web (CDAWeb) at the NASA Goddard Space Flight Center and RPI Principal Investigator Prof. B. W. Reinisch of the University of Massachusetts Lowell for making these CDF files available.

NumericalData.ProviderProcessingLevel: Calibrated data in physical units. Spacecraft MET to UT is converted using history of IMAGE observatory clock drift.

TimeSpan.Note: In Cadence below, the 5 minutes refers to the nominal interval between measurements. Actual cadence of passive measurement varied between 3 to 6 minutes depending on the RPI science plan and design of measurement schedules.

Parameter.Name: Echo Amplitude
Parameter.Description: Echo Amplitude Image [nV].

Parameter.Name: Most Probable Amplitude
Parameter.Description: Most probable amplitude

Structure.Description: Linear 1D array of frequency values, up to 256. Actual number of frequencies for which the voltage spectral density values were measured depends on the choice of frequency sweep (see "Number of Frequencies" parameter and its description below). The "256" value stated in Size is the upper limit.

Parameter.Name: Actual Number of Frequencies
Parameter.Description: Number of frequencies. Detailed plasmagram picture has the original number of frequencies as specified by RPI measurement parameters. Frequency axis varies from plasmagram to plasmagram. Plasmagram *thumbnails* have a fixed frequency axis. The original plasmagram data often requires transformation into thumbnail format by averaging.

Parameter.Name: Time Line
Parameter.Description: Plasmagram Time. The time in EPOCH referes to the beginning of the plasmagram, Use Duration_ms to obtain stop time of the run.
Parameter.Caveats: The 5 minutes refers to the nominal interval between measurements. Actual cadence of passive measurement varied between 3 to 6 minutes depending on the RPI science plan and design of measurement schedules.

Parameter.Name: Measurement Duration
Parameter.Description: Duration of one plasmagram measurement.

Parameter.Name: Base Gain
Parameter.Description: Instrument setting describing receiver gains in X/Y and Z channels, encoded. See data model description at http://ulcar.uml.edu/rpi.html for additional details on base gain decoding procedure.

Parameter.Name: Program Specifications
Parameter.Description: List of 25 parameter values that specify RPI instrument configuration during the measurement. For further detail on parameter value interpretation see data model description document at http://ulcar.uml.edu/rpi.html.

Structure.Description: Linear 1D array of values used to configure RPI instrument for a measurement mode.

Parameter.Name: Nadir crossing MET
Parameter.Description: Nadir crossing MET is the reference MET that uniquely identifies all RPI measurements. MET of the last Nadir crossing before the measurement starts.

Parameter.Name: Start MET
Parameter.Description: Measurement start MET. Start MET is derived using the Nadir crossing MET and the time offset from the first packet header. Might not be unique due to telemetry losses.

Parameter.Name: Operating Mode
Parameter.Description: Calibration, Sounding, Thermal Noise, Relaxation, Whistler, Test Pattern.

Parameter.Name: Pulse Repetition Rate
Parameter.Description: 0.5 pps (1 pulse every 2 sec), 1 pps, 2 pps, 4 pps, 10 pps, 20 pps, 50 pps.

Parameter.Name: Xmtr Antenna Setting
Parameter.Description: 1= Radio Silence (no Tx), 2= X antenna only, 3= Y antenna only, 4= X+Y Linearly polarized, 5= X+Y Right Circularly Polarized, 6= X+Y Left Circularly Polarized, 7= X+Y Right/Left Alternated, 8= X+Y Lin/Lin90 Alternated.

Parameter.Name: Coupler Mode
Parameter.Description: 0= OFF (untuned), 1= ON (tuned)

Parameter.Name: Operating Mode
Parameter.Description: 1= 16-chip complementary, 2= FM Chirp, 3= Staggered Pulse Sequence, 4= Long Pulse, 5= Short Pulse, 6= 0.5 s Pulse, 7= 1.95 s Pulse, 8= 8-chip complementary, 9= 4-chip complementary.

Parameter.Name: Gain Control
Parameter.Description: 0= Fixed Gain, 1= Auto Gain.

Parameter.Name: Frequency Search Enabled
Parameter.Description: 0= Search of quiet frequencies disabled, 1= Search of quiet frequencies enabled.

Parameter.Name: Peak Power Constraint
Parameter.Description: Total RPI Peak Power Consumption Constraint.

Parameter.Name: Actual Number of Ranges
Parameter.Description: Number of Ranges, depending on program setting and processing.

Parameter.Name: Range
Parameter.Description: Range readings for 151 range bins.

Parameter.Name: Echo Azimuth angle
Parameter.Description: Echo Azimuth angle. Values 0 to 254 cover 0 to 360 degrees.

Parameter.Name: Echo Zenith angle
Parameter.Description: Echo Zenith angle.

Parameter.Name: Echo Doppler Number
Parameter.Description: Echo Doppler Number.

Parameter.Name: Doppler Translation
Parameter.Description: Translates Doppler Number to an actual Doppler Frequency. The entries are calculated from program parameters.
